articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
Hello there!! Thank you for visiting my page. A little bit about me, my name is Nelson Barrientos; I was born in El Salvador but have been living in the United States since 2010. I’m a very outgoing person who enjoys many things in life. I like watching sports, especially soccer. I’m a big Real Madrid fan. I also like to do outdoor activities such as hiking, biking, and kayaking. I’m also a big fan of Marvel and Star Wars movies.
I’m currently a Human Genetics PhD student at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. Before coming to Baltimore, I went to school for undergrad and grad school at the University of Virginia (Go Hoos!!) and lived in Charlottesville, VA for about 7 years.
I hope to update this website with many more things, including my research projects, publications, talks, etc. in the future.

            Hello there!!!
            I’m a graduate student in the Human Genetics PhD program at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. I study noncoding regulatory variation in neuropsychiatric and neurodegenerative diseases such as Schizophrenia and Parkinkson Disease.
            
            Education
            M.S. Clinical Research, University of Virginia, 2020
            B.S. Biomedical Engineering, University of Virginia, 2017

(2022) “Enhanced single-cell RNA-seq workflow reveals coronary artery disease cellular cross-talk and candidate drug targets.” Atherosclerosis. 340, 12–22 . American Society of Human Genetics:
Session: Improving our understanding of the causes and consequences of cardiometabolic dysfunction.Abstract and Presentation Title: Differential splicing analysis and mapping splicing quantitative trait loci in coronary artery disease.Presenter: Nelson Barrientos
